intro: Rubia mitis, commonly known as the lesser bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and small, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. Rubia mitis is often found in grassy areas, along roadsides, and in disturbed soils. It is used in traditional medicine and has historical significance in dyeing textiles.
